events.title: Edward VIII Abdicates the British Throne
events.description: King Edward VIII abdicated the throne to marry Wallis Simpson, a twice-divorced American socialite, causing a constitutional crisis in the United Kingdom.
events.significance: Marked a rare voluntary abdication that impacted the British monarchy and led to the reign of George VI.

events.title: Germany and Italy Declare War on the United States
events.description: Following the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor, Germany and Italy declared war on the United States, expanding World War II into a truly global conflict.
events.significance: United States formally entered World War II against the Axis powers in Europe and Africa.

events.title: The Lions Club International is Founded
events.description: The Lions Clubs International was founded in Chicago, Illinois, aiming to promote community service and humanitarian efforts worldwide.
events.significance: Became one of the world's largest secular service organizations.

events.title: Nobel Peace Prize Awarded to Yasser Arafat, Yitzhak Rabin, and Shimon Peres
events.description: The Nobel Peace Prize was awarded jointly to Yasser Arafat, Yitzhak Rabin, and Shimon Peres for their efforts in the Oslo Accords towards peace between Israel and Palestine.
events.significance: Recognized significant milestones in the Middle East peace process.
